item.title: Excitonic Effects in Phonons: Reshaping the Graphene Kohn Anomalies and Lifetimes
item.description:
Author(s): Alberto Guandalini, Francesco Macheda, Giovanni Caldarelli, and Francesco Mauri

We develop an ab initio framework that captures the impact of electron-electron and electron-hole interactions on phonon properties. This enables the inclusion of excitonic effects in the optical phonon dispersions and lifetimes of graphene, both near the center ($\mathrm{Γ}$) and at the border ($K$…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076401] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Alberto Guandalini, Francesco Macheda, Giovanni Caldarelli, and Francesco Mauri

We develop an ab initio framework that captures the impact of electron-electron and electron-hole interactions on phonon properties. This enables the inclusion of excitonic effects in the optical phonon dispersions and lifetimes of graphene, both near the center (Γ) and at the border (K) of the Bril…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076401] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.dc:title: Excitonic Effects in Phonons: Reshaping the Graphene Kohn Anomalies and Lifetimes
item.dc:creator: Alberto Guandalini, Francesco Macheda, Giovanni Caldarelli, and Francesco Mauri

item.title: $1/5$ and $1/3$ Magnetization Plateaux in the Spin $1/2$ Chain System ${\mathrm{YbAlO}}_{3}$
item.description:
Author(s): P. Mokhtari, S. Galeski, U. Stockert, L. Behera, S. E. Nikitin, R. Wawrzyńczak, R. Küchler, M. Brando, L. Vasylechko, O. A. Starykh, and E. Hassinger

Quasi-one-dimensional magnets can host an ordered longitudinal spin-density wave state (LSDW) in magnetic field at low temperature, when longitudinal correlations are strengthened by Ising anisotropies. In the $S=1/2$ Heisenberg antiferromagnet ${\mathrm{YbAlO}}_{3}$ this happens via Ising-like inte…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076704] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): P. Mokhtari, S. Galeski, U. Stockert, L. Behera, S. E. Nikitin, R. Wawrzyńczak, R. Küchler, M. Brando, L. Vasylechko, O. A. Starykh, and E. Hassinger

Quasi-one-dimensional magnets can host an ordered longitudinal spin-density wave state (LSDW) in magnetic field at low temperature, when longitudinal correlations are strengthened by Ising anisotropies. In the S=1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnet YbAlO3 this happens via Ising-like interchain interaction…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076704] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.dc:title: $1/5$ and $1/3$ Magnetization Plateaux in the Spin $1/2$ Chain System ${\mathrm{YbAlO}}_{3}$

item.title: Structural Evidence for the Spin Collapse in High Pressure Solid Oxygen
item.description:
Author(s): Federico Aiace Gorelli, Philip Dalladay-Simpson, Gaston Garbarino, Mohamed Mezouar, Julien Haines, and Mario Santoro

New evidence supports the idea that solid oxygen switches under pressure to an exotic entangled state.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076101] Published Tue Aug 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Federico Aiace Gorelli, Philip Dalladay-Simpson, Gaston Garbarino, Mohamed Mezouar, Julien Haines, and Mario Santoro

New evidence supports the idea that solid oxygen switches under pressure to an exotic entangled state.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076101] Published Tue Aug 12, 2025
item.dc:title: Structural Evidence for the Spin Collapse in High Pressure Solid Oxygen
item.dc:creator: Federico Aiace Gorelli, Philip Dalladay-Simpson, Gaston Garbarino, Mohamed Mezouar, Julien Haines, and Mario Santoro

item.title: Strong Kitaev Interaction in ${\text{BaCo}}_{2}({\mathrm{AsO}}_{4}{)}_{2}$
item.description:
Author(s): Pavel A. Maksimov, Shengtao Jiang (蒋晟韬), L. P. Regnault, and A. L. Chernyshev

Inelastic neutron scattering results together with analytical and density-matrix renormalization group numerical analyses point to a dominant Kitaev term in the model description of BaCo2(AsO4)2.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066703] Published Thu Aug 07, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Pavel A. Maksimov, Shengtao Jiang (蒋晟韬), L. P. Regnault, and A. L. Chernyshev

Inelastic neutron scattering results together with analytical and density-matrix renormalization group numerical analyses point to a dominant Kitaev term in the model description of BaCo2(AsO4)2.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066703] Published Thu Aug 07, 2025
item.dc:title: Strong Kitaev Interaction in ${\text{BaCo}}_{2}({\mathrm{AsO}}_{4}{)}_{2}$
item.dc:creator: Pavel A. Maksimov, Shengtao Jiang (蒋晟韬), L. P. Regnault, and A. L. Chernyshev

item.title: Mapping Delocalization of Impurity Bands across Archetypal Mott-Anderson Transition
item.description:
Author(s): M. Parzer, F. Garmroudi, A. Riss, T. Mori, A. Pustogow, and E. Bauer

Tailoring charge transport in solids on demand is the overarching goal of condensed-matter research as it is crucial for electronic applications. Yet, often the proper tuning knob is missing and extrinsic factors such as impurities and disorder impede coherent conduction. Here, we control the very b…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066302] Published Wed Aug 06, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): M. Parzer, F. Garmroudi, A. Riss, T. Mori, A. Pustogow, and E. Bauer

Tailoring charge transport in solids on demand is the overarching goal of condensed-matter research as it is crucial for electronic applications. Yet, often the proper tuning knob is missing and extrinsic factors such as impurities and disorder impede coherent conduction. Here, we control the very b…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066302] Published Wed Aug 06, 2025

item.title: Chirally Protected State Manipulation by Tuning One-Dimensional Statistics
item.description:
Author(s): F. Theel, M. Bonkhoff, P. Schmelcher, T. Posske, and N. L. Harshman

Chiral symmetry is broken by typical interactions in lattice models, but the statistical interactions embodied in the anyon-Hubbard model are an exception. This is an example for a correlated hopping model where chiral symmetry protects a degenerate zero-energy subspace. Complementary to the traditi…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 063401] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): F. Theel, M. Bonkhoff, P. Schmelcher, T. Posske, and N. L. Harshman

Chiral symmetry is broken by typical interactions in lattice models, but the statistical interactions embodied in the anyon-Hubbard model are an exception. This is an example for a correlated hopping model where chiral symmetry protects a degenerate zero-energy subspace. Complementary to the traditi…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 063401] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025

item.title: Visualization of Intervalley Coherent Phase in ${\mathrm{PtSe}}_{2}/\text{bilayer}$ Graphene Heterojunction
item.description:
Author(s): Kai Fan, Ting-Fei Guo, Bohao Li, Wen-Xuan Qiu, Jian-Wang Zhou, Wen-Hao Zhang, Chao-Fei Liu, Fengcheng Wu, and Ying-Shuang Fu

The intervalley coherent (IVC) phase in graphene systems arises from the coherent superposition of wave functions of opposite valleys, whose direct microscopic visualization provides pivotal insight into the emergent physics. Here, we successfully visualize the IVC phase in a heterostructure of mono…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066201] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Kai Fan, Ting-Fei Guo, Bohao Li, Wen-Xuan Qiu, Jian-Wang Zhou, Wen-Hao Zhang, Chao-Fei Liu, Fengcheng Wu, and Ying-Shuang Fu

The intervalley coherent (IVC) phase in graphene systems arises from the coherent superposition of wave functions of opposite valleys, whose direct microscopic visualization provides pivotal insight into the emergent physics. Here, we successfully visualize the IVC phase in a heterostructure of mono…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066201] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025

item.title: Magnetic and Ferroelectric Phase Diagram of Twisted ${\mathrm{CrI}}_{3}$ Layers
item.description:
Author(s): Haoshen Ye and Shuai Dong

Twisting layers provide a rich ore for exotic physics in low dimensions. Despite the abundant discoveries of twistronics from the aspect of electronic structures, ferroic moiré textures are more plain and thus less concerned. Rigid lattice models are straightforward which can give a rough but intuit…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066701] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Haoshen Ye and Shuai Dong

Twisting layers provide a rich ore for exotic physics in low dimensions. Despite the abundant discoveries of twistronics from the aspect of electronic structures, ferroic moiré textures are more plain and thus less concerned. Rigid lattice models are straightforward which can give a rough but intuit…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066701] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025

item.title: Lippmann-Schwinger Approach for Accurate Photoelectron Wave Functions and Angle-Resolved Photoemission Spectra from First Principles
item.description:
Author(s): Ji Hoon Ryoo and Cheol-Hwan Park

The Lippmann-Schwinger approach to calculating photoelectron wave functions enables accurate simulations of ARPES spectra using DFT.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 056403] Published Fri Aug 01, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Ji Hoon Ryoo and Cheol-Hwan Park

The Lippmann-Schwinger approach to calculating photoelectron wave functions enables accurate simulations of ARPES spectra using DFT.
